verses.roman:
ātma-moho nṛṇām eva
kalpate deva-māyayā
suhṛd durhṛd udāsīna
iti dehātma-māninām

synonyms: ātma—about the self; mohaḥ—the bewilderment; nṛṇām—of men; eva—only; kalpate—is effected; deva—of the Supreme Lord; māyayā—by the illusory, material energy; suhṛt—a friend; durhṛt—an enemy; udāsīnaḥ—a neutral party; iti—thus thinking; deha—the body; ātma—as the self; māninām—for those who consider.
translation: The Supreme Lord's Māyā makes men forget their real selves, and thus, taking the body for the self, they consider others to be friends, enemies or neutral parties.
